hints_html:
The formula for the trapezoid rule is given by

\(T_{n} := \frac{\Delta x}{2}\left(f(x_{0}) + 2f(x_{1}) + 2f(x_{2}) + ... + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_{n})\right)\)
hints_latex:
The formula for the trapezoid rule is given by

$T_{n} := \frac{\Delta x}{2}\left(f(x_{0}) + 2f(x_{1}) + 2f(x_{2}) + ... + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_{n})\right)$
hints_raw:
The formula for the trapezoid rule is given by

<math>
T_{n} := \frac{\Delta x}{2}\left(f(x_{0}) + 2f(x_{1}) + 2f(x_{2}) + ... + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_{n})\right)
</math>
question: 5 (a)
sols_html:
Since the formula for the trapezoid rule can be given by

\[\begin{aligned} T_{n} = \frac{\Delta x}{2}\left(f(x_{0}) + 2f(x_{1}) + 2f(x_{2}) + ... + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_{n})\right)\end{aligned}\]

and we know that we want to evaluate this rule using \(n = 4\), we have

\[\begin{aligned} x_{i} = a + i\Delta x = 0 + i\frac{4-0}{4}\end{aligned}\]

and thus, the trapezoidal approximation that we need is

\[\begin{aligned} T_{4} &= \frac{1}{2}\left(f(0) + 2f(1) + 2f(2) + 2f(3) + f(4)\right) \\ &= \frac{1}{2} (1 + 2(2) + 2(0) +2(-2) + (-4)) = \frac{-3}{2}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Since the formula for the trapezoid rule can be given by

:<math>
T_{n} = \frac{\Delta x}{2}\left(f(x_{0}) + 2f(x_{1}) + 2f(x_{2}) + ... + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_{n})\right)
</math>

and we know that we want to evaluate this rule using <math> n = 4 </math>, we have

:<math>
x_{i} = a + i\Delta x = 0 + i\frac{4-0}{4}
</math>

and thus, the trapezoidal approximation that we need is

:<math> \begin{align}
T_{4} &= \frac{1}{2}\left(f(0) + 2f(1) + 2f(2) + 2f(3) + f(4)\right) \\
&= \frac{1}{2} (1 + 2(2) + 2(0) +2(-2) + (-4)) = \frac{-3}{2}
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
Full-Solution Problem. Justify your answer and show all your work. Simplification of the answer is not required.

An unknown function \(f(x)\) has the following values: \(f(0) = 1,\) \(f(1) = 2,\) \(f(2) = 0,\) \(f(3) = -2,\) \(f(4) = -4.\)

Write down the trapezoidal approximation \(T_4\) for \(\int_0^4 f(x) dx.\)

your work.} Simplification of the answer is not required.

$f(1) = 2,$ $f(2) = 0,$ $f(3) = -2,$ $f(4) = -4.$
